title: Pythia - Shadows Of A Broken Past (2014)
description:
n:	Pythia  Uloader asks- Can anyone comment?



Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ PYTHIA (pronounced pie-thee-ya) are a group of classical and metal inspired musicians who believe that the art of music is a hallowed path, only to be undertaken by the strong willed and the dedicated.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Fronted by Emily Alice Ovenden, a published novelist and member of the number one selling act Ã¢â‚¬ËœMediaeval BaebesÃ¢â‚¬â„¢, PYTHIA were formed at the end of 2009 and brought together by a love of fantasy and gothic imagery and literature, the darker, more enigmatic classical works, and, of course; heavy metal.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Emily Alice grew up in a mock gothic castle in Cornwall and began singing and writing ghost stories at an early age. The themes and imagery that she grew up with have naturally influenced her song writing.

Ã¢â‚¬Å“PYTHIA is a band dedicated to making music which not only incorporates gothic themes but also the many aspects of power metal which we feel help to give strength and positivity to the darker side of our
stories,Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ (Emily Alice Ovenden)

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Musical pedigrees within the band stem from UK rock and metal projects such as thrashers Ã¢â‚¬ËœDescentÃ¢â‚¬â„¢, black-metallers Ã¢â‚¬ËœAbgottÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ and southern fried rockers Ã¢â‚¬ËœHead-OnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Drummer and founder member Marc Dyos, with guitarists Ross White and Tim Neale, combing power metal beats, arrangements and riffs with soaring lead work and tastefully placed progressive overtones, beautifully embellished with epic symphonic keyboards from classically trained maestro Richard Holland.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Debut album Ã¢â‚¬Å“BTVEÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ released October 2009.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Mixed and mastered by Jacob Hansen (Volbeat, Destruction, Mercenary).

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Released through Genepool / Universal UK and worldwide and with Japanese label Spinning in 2011.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Guest appearance by legendary British actor Brian Blessed.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Award winning artwork by Hayley Madden.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ First single from Ã¢â‚¬Å“BTVEÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, Ã¢â‚¬Å“Sarah (Bury Her)Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ released August 2009, also featuring cover of Gary Moore classic Ã¢â‚¬Å“Thunder RisingÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, as approved by Gary Moore himself.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ The video for Ã¢â‚¬Å“Sarah (Bury Her)Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ received airplay on Scuzz and Lava Music TV.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ The second single, Ã¢â‚¬Å“Army Of The DamnedÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½, accompanied by a video consisting of live and backstage footage from the bands tour of Benelux in 2010 including the Power, Prog and Metal Festival in Belgium where the majority of the live footage was taken.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Ã¢â‚¬Å“Army Of The DamnedÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ released as a downloadable, playable track for the computer game Ã¢â‚¬ËœRock BandÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ and has proved very popular with gamers, with fans filming their attempts at highest scores for YouTube!

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ 2011 has seen Ã¢â‚¬Å“BTVEÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ released in Japan with a big marketing push and exclusive new artwork through the Spinning label.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ BTVE quickly received a plethora of fantastic reviews, articles and buzz from the rock and metal press including Kerrang, Metal Hammer, Terrorizer, Classic Rock, Bazaar, Classic Rock Prog, FAE and Powerplay magazines.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Ã¢â‚¬Å“Sweet CantationÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ Track of the Day on Classic Rock Prog website

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Emily featured as Ã¢â‚¬ËœMiss DecemberÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ in the Metal Hammer Ã¢â‚¬ËœMaidens of MetalÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ 2010 calendar

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Following airplay on the Bruce Dickinson rock show on BBC 6, the band were invited into the studio for an interview with Bruce in April 2010.

Ã¢â‚¬Å“... [Beneath the Veiled Embrace] is about EmilyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s siren-esque contribution [to the metal scene], never descending into a vacuous vocal master-class.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ - Metal Hammer

Ã¢â‚¬Å“... a truly mesmerizing mix of thrash, power and ladylike class.Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ Ã¢â‚¬â€œ Terrorizer

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ With a powerful and dramatic live show, PYTHIA have already played with some impressive acts such as Arch Enemy, Scorpions, Ministry, Tarja Turunen, Fields Of The Nephelim and Threshold, at some of the UKs most prestigious venues, including ShepherdÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Bush Empire, The Forum and The Electric Ballroom.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ PYTHIA represented the female fronted metal community at one of the UKÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s largest Metal festivals Bloodstock Open Air 09, headlining the new Sophie Lancaster stage. Bloodstock founder and promoter Paul Gregory said:

"Adding PYTHIA to the festival was a natural choice to represent the female Gothic community and the launch of the Sophie Lancaster Stage. This stage is in memory of a young girl whose life was needlessly
cut short by intolerance and mindless brutality. Sophie celebrated life through the music and lifestyle she chose, PYTHIA's ideology mirror this perfectly".

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ The band have also played dates in mainland Europe including triumphant appearances at Metal Female Voices Festival 2010 and Prog, Power & Metal fest 2010 in Belgium.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ To follow up such a strong debut the band needed to raise the stakes and have done so in spectacular fashion with the second chapter of PYTHIAÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s tale... Ã¢â‚¬Å“The Serpents CurseÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Once again the band chose award winning producer Jacob Hansen to handle mixing and mastering duties.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ The Serpents Curse delivers a darker, heavier, bleaker and yet even more engrossing version of PYTHIAÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s epic emotional storytelling and is all the more powerful and poignant for it.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ Album imagery by legendary artist Brian Froud (Star Wars, Labyrinth, The Dark Crystal), expanded upon by up and coming artist Gurdish Haugsdal.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ TSC features photos from the bands photo-shoot with multi award winning acclaimed photographer Clive Arrowsmith (Kate Bush, Jeremy Irons, Christian Slater)

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ This is the sound of a band flying the flag not only for female fronted metal in the UK, but British metal full stop.

Ã¢â‚¬Â¢ In a time of stylized rock, sappy emo and marketing ploys, Pythia are amongst the last few hard working, genuine metal bands, singing, writing and playing from the heart, fighting their corner and taking the listener with them on their journey, their quest, their battle.



Band Members

Marc Dyos Drums
Ross White Guitars
Emily Alice Ovendeen Vocals
Mark Harrington Bass
Oz Wright Guitars
Asmodai Keyboards
